description: Manage iot connector fhir destination with healthcareapis.

commands.name: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination create
commands.summary: Create an IoT Connector FHIR destination resource with the specified parameters.
commands.syntax:
az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination create --fhir-destination-name
                                                                  --fhir-service-resource-id
                                                                  --iot-connector-name
                                                                  --resource-group
                                                                  --resource-identity-resolution-type {Create, Lookup}
                                                                  --workspace-name
                                                                  [--content]
                                                                  [--etag]
                                                                  [--location]
                                                                  [--no-wait]
examples: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination create --fhir-destination-name "dest1" --iot-connector-name "blue" --location "westus" --content "{\"template\":[{\"template\":{\"codes\":[{\"code\":\"8867-4\",\"display\":\"Heart rate\",\"system\":\"http://loinc.org\"}],\"periodInterval\":60,\"typeName\":\"heartrate\",\"value\":{\"defaultPeriod\":5000,\"unit\":\"count/min\",\"valueName\":\"hr\",\"valueType\":\"SampledData\"}},\"templateType\":\"CodeValueFhir\"}],\"templateType\":\"CollectionFhirTemplate\"}" --fhir-service-resource-id "subscriptions/11111111-2222-3333-4444-555566667777/resourceGroups/myrg/providers/Microsoft.HealthcareApis/workspaces/myworkspace/fhirservices/myfhirservice" --resource-identity-resolution-type "Create" --resource-group "testRG" --workspace-name "workspace1"

commands.name: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination delete
commands.summary: Deletes an IoT Connector FHIR destination.
commands.syntax:
az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination delete [--fhir-destination-name]
                                                                  [--ids]
                                                                  [--iot-connector-name]
                                                                  [--no-wait]
                                                                  [--resource-group]
                                                                  [--subscription]
                                                                  [--workspace-name]
                                                                  [--yes]
examples: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination delete --fhir-destination-name "dest1" --iot-connector-name "blue" --resource-group "testRG" --workspace-name "workspace1"

commands.name: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination list
commands.summary: Lists all FHIR destinations for the given IoT Connector.
commands.syntax:
az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination list --iot-connector-name
                                                                --resource-group
                                                                --workspace-name
examples: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination list --iot-connector-name "blue" --resource-group "testRG" --workspace-name "workspace1"

commands.name: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination show
commands.summary: Gets the properties of the specified Iot Connector FHIR destination.
commands.syntax:
az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination show [--fhir-destination-name]
                                                                [--ids]
                                                                [--iot-connector-name]
                                                                [--resource-group]
                                                                [--subscription]
                                                                [--workspace-name]
examples: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination show --fhir-destination-name "dest1" --iot-connector-name "blue" --resource-group "testRG" --workspace-name "workspace1"

commands.name: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination update
commands.summary: Update an IoT Connector FHIR destination resource with the specified parameters.
commands.syntax:
az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination update --fhir-service-resource-id
                                                                  --resource-identity-resolution-type {Create, Lookup}
                                                                  [--add]
                                                                  [--content]
                                                                  [--etag]
                                                                  [--fhir-destination-name]
                                                                  [--force-string]
                                                                  [--ids]
                                                                  [--iot-connector-name]
                                                                  [--location]
                                                                  [--no-wait]
                                                                  [--remove]
                                                                  [--resource-group]
                                                                  [--set]
                                                                  [--subscription]
                                                                  [--workspace-name]

commands.name: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition of the healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination is met.
commands.syntax:
az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination wait [--created]
                                                                [--custom]
                                                                [--deleted]
                                                                [--exists]
                                                                [--fhir-destination-name]
                                                                [--ids]
                                                                [--interval]
                                                                [--iot-connector-name]
                                                                [--resource-group]
                                                                [--subscription]
                                                                [--timeout]
                                                                [--updated]
                                                                [--workspace-name]
examples: az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination wait --fhir-destination-name "dest1" --iot-connector-name "blue" --resource-group "testRG" --workspace-name "workspace1" --created
az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination wait --fhir-destination-name "dest1" --iot-connector-name "blue" --resource-group "testRG" --workspace-name "workspace1" --updated
az healthcareapis workspace iot-connector fhir-destination wait --fhir-destination-name "dest1" --iot-connector-name "blue" --resource-group "testRG" --workspace-name "workspace1" --deleted
